column4: you need to check out the ARM repositories of the ubuntu version you gonna use

yes. sheevaplug is an ARM based devices

uuhh youtube stuff I mean
Youtube stuff? I don't get you? :|
youtube nice website to play lots of uselss videos
you need a browser with a plugin to use flash content in order to use youtube
such plugins for arm are bad
what are you worried about ?
Oh! I got it! I thought YouTube has to do something with the hardware. Yeah! absense of flash won't be a big deal.
I just want to setup something to download some torrents and use less electricity
well you can use flash. there's a gnash plugin for mozilla. but I had to notice most recent gnash version is incompatible with latest youtube
well then you all set. I would recommend to use ubuntu-server rootfs then
